results.title: Furnishing is fun
results.brief_description: How an average family in 1961, whose children have grown up, refurnishes the home. Shows the range of furnishings available in Australia, the advisory services, especially colour consultants and gives some indication of costs involved. Narrated by Gordon Bell and scripted by Burton Graham.

results.title: The Fur seal
results.brief_description: A complete photographic study of the fur seal in one of their main habitats - the Pribilof Islands in the Bering Sea. Investigates the fur seals’ evolution, adaptation to its environment and habits.

results.title: Fundamentals of the Nervous System
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology program. Unit 4. Physiology”.
Live photography, microphotography, animated drawings and medical demonstrations illustrate the functions, diversions and specific tasks of the nervous system. Shows how it conveys information from sense organs to brain, co-ordinates information with experience and directs muscles and other organs to carry out adaptive behaviour.

results.title: The Fundamentals of tennis
results.brief_description: Donald Budge demonstrates forehand, backhand, service, volley and half-volley; the strokes are analysed and helpful suggestions for their proper execution are made. The film was sponsored by the USA Lawn Tennis Association.

results.title: Fundamentals of public speaking
results.brief_description: A lawyer, asked for advice after a student has made a poor platform appearance, explains the basic rules for good public speaking; analyse your subject, audience and purpose; plan your material by selecting, arranging and illustrate your speech in a direct, distinct and lively manner.

results.title: Fundamentals of photography: the basic camera
results.brief_description: A simple explanation of how a camera functions showing the working of the various parts including the film holders, the lens and the shutters. A brief history of cameras is traced and the different types of camera are briefly described.

results.brief_description: This film shows the chemistry and procedure in developing still camera film, and explains the composition and function of the developing solution.

results.title: Fundamentals of massage
results.brief_description: Shows proper position of patient for massage; how to perform superficial and deep stroking and the importance of rhythm in stroking; how to knead; how to perform friction; and the value of each type of massage movement. The value of each type of massaging movement are also dealt with.

results.title: The Fundamentals of film making - No.2: using the camera
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Fundamentals of film making”.
An introduction to moving picture camera use; loading, running off leader and how to avoid fogging; how to keep the camera steady and use of a tripod; panning and common faults to avoid; the use of the zoom and the need for restraint; placing of the camera and avoidance of the jump cut; pitfalls of reverse action and parallax.
results.title_for_label: The Fundamentals of film making - No.2: using the camera

group_siblings.title: The Fundamentals of film making. No.1: learning the language

results.title: The Fundamentals of film making. No.1: learning the language
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Fundamentals of film making”.
An introduction to moving picture photography using the written word in an analogy with the completed film: how a succession of single frames, equivalent of a letter in a single word, gives an impression of continuous movement; the definition and examples of a “shot” likening it to a word in a sentence; then the “sequence” equivalent of a paragraph or chapter, depending on length. The purpose terms used and results achieved when camera angles are varied and the camera moved, and the effect of varying the time scale. How to make basic transitions (cut, fade, mix) from shot to shot.
